reference:
This is derived (with permission) from the data set car.all in
S-PLUS, but with some further clean up of variable names and definitions.
title: Automobile Data from 'Consumer Reports' 1990
description:
Description
Data on 111 cars, taken from pages 235–255, 281–285 and 287–288 of the
April 1990 Consumer Reports Magazine.

parameters.Gear2: the overall gear ratio, high gear, for automatic transmission
parameters.Gear.Ratio: the overall gear ratio, high gear, for manual transmission
parameters.Trans1:
manual transmission, a factor with levels ‘⁠⁠’,
‘⁠man.4⁠’, ‘⁠man.5⁠’ and ‘⁠man.6⁠’
parameters.Steering: steering type offered: manual, power, or both
parameters.Mileage:
a numeric vector of gas mileage in miles/gallon as
tested by CU; contains NAs.
parameters.Turning: the radius of the turning circle in feet
parameters.Type:
a factor giving the general type of car.
The levels are: ‘⁠Small⁠’, ‘⁠Sporty⁠’, ‘⁠Compact⁠’, ‘⁠Medium⁠’, ‘⁠Large⁠’, ‘⁠Van⁠’
parameters.Frt.Leg.Room: maximum front leg room, in inches, as measured by CU
parameters.Length: overall length, in inches, as supplied by manufacturer
parameters.Width: width of car, in inches, as supplied by manufacturer
parameters.Wheel.base: length of wheelbase, in inches, as supplied by manufacturer
parameters.Height: height of car, in inches, as supplied by manufacturer
parameters.RearShld: rear shoulder room, in inches, as measured by CU
parameters.Trans2:
automatic transmission, a factor with levels ‘⁠⁠’,
‘⁠auto.3⁠’, ‘⁠auto.4⁠’, and ‘⁠auto.CVT⁠’.  No car is
missing both the manual and automatic transmission variables, but
several had both as options
parameters.Price: list price with standard equipment, in dollars
parameters.HP.revs: the red line—the maximum safe engine speed in rpm
parameters.Frt.Shld: front shoulder room, in inches, as measured by CU
parameters.Rear.Seating:
rear fore-and-aft seating room, in inches,
as measured by CU
parameters.Eng.Rev: engine revolutions per mile, or engine speed at 60 mph
parameters.Country:
a factor giving the country in which the car was
manufactured
parameters.Front.Hd:
distance between the car's head-liner and the head
of a 5 ft. 9 in. front seat passenger, in inches, as measured by CU
parameters.Weight:
an order statistic giving the relative weights of the
cars; 1 is the lightest and 111 is the heaviest
parameters.Sratio.m:
Number of turns of the steering
wheel required for a turn of 30 foot radius, manual steering
parameters.Rear.Hd:
distance between the car's head-liner and the head of
a 5 ft 9 in. rear seat passenger, in inches, as measured by CU
parameters.Sratio.p:
Number of turns of the steering
wheel required for a turn of 30 foot radius, power steering
parameters.Reliability:
an ordered factor with levels ‘⁠Much worse⁠’ <
‘⁠worse⁠’ < ‘⁠average⁠’ < ‘⁠better⁠’ < ‘⁠Much
	better⁠’: contains NAs.
parameters.Model2: alternate name, if the car was sold under two labels

format: The data frame contains the following columns
